answers.answer: 1. If the circule moves its not likely a scar which should always be in the same place. The most common reason for a circle that floats is a Weiss Ring which is the attachment of the vitreous to the optic nerve. Its often pulled lose in a posterior vitreous detachment.2. Double vision is a serious symptom in that it can be due to strokes, aneurysms, diabetes. Get in to see the retina Eye MD or your regular Eye MD immedaitely.JCH IIIMD

question: For the last 3 years I have been seeing a transparent/blurry circle on my right eye. This transparent circle is centered whenever I stare at something. This isn't a blind spot, but it's more noticable at night (up to the point where it  covers/darkens my centered vision. This is only when there are no lights at all). I recently visited a retina specialist, and they told me I have a  scar on/near my retina. Could this be the reason why I have  see this transparent/blurry circle? If so, can it be removed?My next problem is common. I have been seeing double for the last 2 weeks. It's not very drastic since I see double on certain things. What are some treatments for double/distored vision?Thanks in advance.
title: 2 problems
